Key Match Events: Virgil van Dijk received his first red card in his Netherlands career during the 1-1 Nations League draw with Hungary.
Denzel Dumfries scored a late equalizer for the Netherlands after Van Dijk's red card.
Roland Sallai scored the first-half goal for Hungary.
Post-Match Reflections: Virgil van Dijk expressed anger and frustration over his first yellow card, which he received for dissent.
Netherlands coach Ronald Koeman was perplexed by Van Dijk's first booking and felt the foul on Donyell Malen warranted a red card.
Koeman felt a 'reasonable feeling' after the draw, noting the team's resilience in equalizing and defending well despite being down to ten men.
Others: Virgil van Dijk will not be available for the Netherlands' next match against Germany and has returned to Liverpool.
Koeman confirmed he will not add to his squad for the upcoming match against Germany.
